com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Class PSAaRelationship

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSComponent
      com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelationship
          com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSAaRelationship
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSComponent, Serializable, Cloneable
public class PSAaRelationship
extends PSRelationship

This class adds a few methods that are specific to Active Assembly category of relationships to make it more convenient and easy to manipulate active assembly relationships. All the relationship properties that are specific to active assembly are exposed in this class. Note these can also be manipulated from the map returned by PSRelationship.getProperties() object however, it must be avoided and may result in expected behavior. For example, if one sets the sort order using the property map, it will most probably be overridden by the active assembly processor.

Author:
RammohanVangapalli
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

PSAaRelationship

public PSAaRelationship(PSLocator owner,
                        PSLocator dependent,
                        PSSlotType slot,
                        PSContentTypeVariant variant,
                        PSRelationshipConfig config)
Deprecated. use PSAaRelationship(PSLocator, PSLocator, IPSTemplateSlot, IPSAssemblyTemplate) instead.

Construct a new active assembly relaionship knowing the owner locator, contentid of the dependent, id of the slot the dependent belongs and the variantid of the dependent.

Parameters:
owner - locator of the parent or owner item of the relationship, must not be null.
dependent - locator of the dependent item of the relationship, must not be null.
slot - slot in the parent item's variant to which the dependent belongs to. Must not be null.
variant - variant of the dependent item related to the owner item via this relationship. Must not be null.
config - relationship config object that the slot accepts, must not be null.

PSAaRelationship

public PSAaRelationship(PSRelationship relationship,
                        PSSlotType slot,
                        PSContentTypeVariant variant)
Deprecated. use PSAaRelationship(PSRelationship, IPSTemplateSlot, IPSAssemblyTemplate) instead.

Constructs an active assembly relationship given the relationship, slot and the variant objects this relationship is associated with. The slotid and variantid properties from the source relationship (if present) are ignored. Exception is thrown if the relationship config name of the supplied relationship does not match with that for the supplied slot.

Parameters:
relationship - source relationship object must not be null.
slot - must not be null.
variant - must not be null.

PSAaRelationship

public PSAaRelationship(PSRelationship relationship,
                        IPSTemplateSlot slot,
                        IPSAssemblyTemplate template)
Constructs an active assembly relationship given the relationship, slot and the template objects this relationship is associated with. The slot id and template id properties from the source relationship (if present) are ignored.

Parameters:
relationship - source relationship object must not be null.
slot - the slot object, must not be null. This is a transient object and will not be persisted with the relationship when the relationship instance is saved in the repository.
template - the template object, must not be null. This is a transient object and will not be persisted with the relationship when the relationship instance is saved in the repository.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the relationship config of the supplied relationship does not contain user properties for slot id and template id.
Since:
6.0

PSAaRelationship

public PSAaRelationship(PSLocator owner,
                        PSLocator dependent,
                        IPSTemplateSlot slot,
                        IPSAssemblyTemplate template)
Constructs an active assembly relationship between the specified owner and dependent, assigning the specified slot and template as properties of the relationship. The relationship configuration is determined by the slot.

Parameters:
owner - locator of the parent or owner item of the relationship, must not be null.
dependent - locator of the dependent item of the relationship, must not be null.
slot - the slot that will be assigned to the relationship, not null.
template - the template of the dependent item that will be assigned to the relationship. Must not be null.
Since:
6.0

PSAaRelationship

public PSAaRelationship(PSRelationship source)
Constructs an instance from the specified relationship object.

Note, it is caller's responsibility to set the slot and variant objects for this instance.

Parameters:
source - the source object, may not be null and its category must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY. The properties of both IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_SLOTID and IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_VARIANTID must not be null or empty.
Method Detail

setSlot

public void setSlot(PSSlotType slot,
                    PSRelationshipConfig config)
Deprecated. use setSlot(PSSlotType) instead.

Set the slot for the dependent itens of the the relationship.

Parameters:
slot - slot in the parent item's variant to which the dependent belongs to, must not be null.
config - relationship config object that the slot accepts, must not be null. This is not used.

setSlot

public void setSlot(PSSlotType slot)
Deprecated. use setSlot(IPSTemplateSlot) instead.

Set the slot for the dependent item of the the relationship.

Note, the specified slot is a transient object. The association of the specified slot and the relationship will be persisted when the relationship is saved in the repository, but not the slot instance itself.

Parameters:
slot - slot in the parent item's template to which the dependent belongs to, must not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_SLOTID is not one of the registered user properties.

Parameters:

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_SLOTID is not one of the registered user properties.

setVariant

public void setVariant(PSContentTypeVariant variant)
Set the variant for the dependent items in the relationships.

Note, the specified variant is a transient object. The association of the specified variant and the relationship will be persisted when the relationship is saved in the repository, but not the variant instance itself.

Parameters:
variant - the variant to set for the dependent item in the relationship, must not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_VARIANTID is not one of the registered user properties.

setTemplate

public void setTemplate(IPSAssemblyTemplate template)
Set the template for the dependent items in the relationships.

Note, the specified template is a transient object. The association of the specified template and the relationship will be persisted when the relationship is saved in the repository, but not the template instance itself.

Parameters:
template - the template to set for the dependent item in the relationship, must not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the IPSHtmlParameters.SYS_VARIANTID is not one of the registered user properties.

getSlot

public PSSlotType getSlot()
Access method for the slot of the dependent item in the relationship.

Note, the returned slot is a transient object. The association of the slot and the relationship will be persisted when the relationship is saved in the repository, but not the slot instance itself.

Returns:
slot object for the dependent item in the relationship. Never null.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the slot object has not been set yet.

getSlotName

public String getSlotName()
Gets the name of the slot, where the id of the slot is a property of this relationship. However, the name of the slot a transient data, and will not be persisted with this object.

Returns:
slot name, may be null if the slot object has not been set.

getTemplateName

public String getTemplateName()
Gets the name of the template, where the id of the template is a property of this relationship. However, the name of the template is a transient data, and will not be persisted with this object.

Returns:
the template name, may be null if the tempate object has not been set.

getSlotId

public IPSGuid getSlotId()
Gets the id of the slot of the dependent item in the relationship.

Returns:
the slot id, never null.

getTemplateId

public IPSGuid getTemplateId()
Gets the template id of the dependent item in the relationship.

Returns:
template id, never null.

getVariant

public PSContentTypeVariant getVariant()
Access method for the variant of the dependent item in the relationship.

Note, the returned variant is a transient object. The association of the variant and the relationship will be persisted when the relationship is saved in the repository, but not the variant instance itself.

Returns:
variant object for the dependent item in the relationship. Never null.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the variant object has not been set yet.

setSortRank

public void setSortRank(int sortRank)
Sets the sort rank property of the relationship. The sort rank is the position of the dependent item in the slot of its parent item.

Parameters:
sortRank - zero based number.

getSortRank

public int getSortRank()
Gets the sort rank property of the relationship. The sort rank is the position of the dependent item in the slot of its parent item.

Returns:
zero based number. Default to 0.

setSiteId

public void setSiteId(IPSGuid siteId)
Sets the site id property of the relationship.

Parameters:
siteId - the new site id, never null.

getSiteId

public IPSGuid getSiteId()
Gets the site id property of the relationship.

Returns:
the value of the site id property. It may be null if the site id property does not exist in this relationship.

setFolderId

public void setFolderId(int folderId)
Sets the folder id property of the relationship.

Parameters:
folderId - the new folder id. The value of the folder id property will be removed if it is -1.

getFolderId

public int getFolderId()
Gets the folder id property of the relationship.

Returns:
the value of the folder id property. It may be -1 if the folder id property does not exist in this relationship.

getAllAaUserProperties

public List<PSRelationshipPropertyData> getAllAaUserProperties()
Just like PSRelationship.getAllUserProperties(), except it excludes Active Assembly specific user properties.

Returns:
the user properties without Active Assembly specific properties, never null.
